input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Unobserved confounders has a direct effect on maternal smoking status and brown eyes. Cigarette tax has a direct effect on maternal smoking status. Maternal smoking status has a direct effect on brown eyes. Unobserved confounders is unobserved. The overall probability of smoking mother is 43%. The probability of nonsmoking mother and brown eyes is 49%. The probability of smoking mother and brown eyes is 17%. Is the chance of brown eyes larger when observing smoking mother?
